definition: to lure into/to entrap/to trick into/to entice/to induce/to invite/to tempt
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger

sentences.english: I will no longer allow myself to be railroaded into serving on the same committee again.
sentences.chinese: 我不会再让别人诱使为同一个委员会效力了。

sentences.english: Non-pathogen of rhizobacteria can induce a systemic resistance in plants.
sentences.chinese: 根际非病原细菌可诱使植物产生诱导系统抗病性。

sentences.english: It is tempting to prefer the relative simplicity of dynamically-typed languages.
sentences.chinese: 它诱使我们偏爱动态语言的相对简洁。

sentences.english: The salesman led us on about the quality of the product so that Iwould buy it.
sentences.chinese: 售货员诱使我们相信产品的质量以便我买他的产品。

sentences.english: The Serpent tempted Eve to pick the forbidden fruit.
sentences.chinese: 那条毒蛇诱使夏娃摘取禁果。

sentences.english: You can totally trick the camera into making you appear taller and leaner (what belly pooch?).
sentences.chinese: 你完全可以诱使相机，让它使你看起来更高挑苗条。

sentences.english: She was grateful to her companion for not tempting her to swerve.
sentences.chinese: 她感谢她的同伴没有诱使她脱离正轨。

sentences.english: They used fake signal lights to bait the enemy ships onto the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 他们用假信号灯诱使敌船触礁。

sentences.english: Woman whose dancing beguiled herod into giving her the head of john the baptist.
sentences.chinese: 通过跳舞诱使希律王给她施洗约翰人头的女子。

sentences.english: We used strategy to seduce the enemy into attacking the small town that we had ambushed.
sentences.chinese: 我军用计诱使敌人攻打我们布置了埋伏的小镇。

sentences.english: Strength deters aggression; weakness tempts it.
sentences.chinese: 强大阻止侵略，软弱诱使占领。

sentences.english: The salesman inveigled the girl into buying the ring.
sentences.chinese: 店员诱使女孩买下戒子。

sentences.english: China's booming economy is luring many North Koreans to seek work here.
sentences.chinese: 中国快速成长的经济诱使许多朝鲜人来此寻找工作。

sentences.english: They, having first persuaded themselves, contrive to influence their neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 他们首先自己信服了之后，便设法诱使邻居。

sentences.english: Jack holds the man’s medicine to entice him into revealing more information.
sentences.chinese: 杰克控制着他的心脏病药，诱使他交待更多的信息。

sentences.english: It's tempting to react impulsively or emotionally when faced with a business decision.
sentences.chinese: 在面对商业决策时会诱使反应冲动或情绪化。

definition: to coerce (sb into doing sth bad)/to lure (into a trap)/to seduce
to entice/to lure/to scam/to hoodwink/to decoy
to induce/to encourage/to provide guidance/(medicine, chemistry) induction
to use gain as a lure
to wait for an opportunity/to watch for one's chance
to scam/to set a trap/to set up a scheme to defraud people
